page.title: 14Vale of Lune R.U.F.C.
page.content: Lee Hirst and Chris Huntington asked Mr. Alan Alker, a Vale of Lune rugby player, some questions about the club. The Vale have 5 senior teams, 1 colts team and 8 mini teams. The club has been running for about 60 years. The first XV have about 45 to 50 matches in the season, their average attendance is about 300 people per home match. The Vale's most memorable match was when they played in the Lancashire Cup Final in 1985 and lost 11-7 to Waterloo. The most famous club ever to play at the Vale was the Australian International XV. Both Lee and Chris play for a mini team at the Vale as well as playing for the Morecambe High school teams.
